List of Pro-Japanese Professors to Open to S. Korean Public 
    Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The General Student Council of Korea University on March 11decided to open a list of former and incumbent pro-Japanese professors to the public in protest against the rash remarks made by Honorary Professor Han Sung Jo, according to south Korean "MBC".
 The council said that it would form a committee for liquidating the remnant forces of the Japanese imperialists and join the civic organizations in the actions to set right the distorted past history and prevent the second Han Sung Jo from emerging.

Premier of DPRK Cabinet to Visit China
    Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju will soon pay an official good-will visit to the People's Republic of China at
the invitation of Premier of the State Council of the PRC Wen Jiabao.

articles.title: DPRK Government Economic Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves Here to Visit African Countries
    Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK led by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, left here today to visit African countries.
 It was seen off at the airport by Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the SPA, officials concerned and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe.

articles.title: Congratulations to Thai Prime Minister
articles.content:
DPRK Government Economic and Trade Delegation Leaves for China
    Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- A government economic and trade delegation of the DPRK headed by Ri Ryong Nam, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, left here Tuesday to participate in the first meeting of the DPRK-China Committee for
Economic, Trade, Scientific and Technological Cooperation to be held in China.
 It was seen off at the airport by officials concerned and the Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Beninese Ambassador
articles.content:
Congratulations to Thai Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of congratulations to his Thai counterpart Thaksin Shinawatra.
 The message extended sincere congratulations to Thaksin Shinawatra on his reelection as prime minister of Thailand.    
 Believing that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations would continue to grow stronger, the message wished him bigger success in his responsible work for the stability and development of the country.
